page.title: 06Launceston Leisure Centre
page.content: The Leisure Centre was built in 1981 and opened in May of that year. It is owned by the District Council and is supported by the ratepayers. About 1200 to 1500 schoolchildren attend each year. The centre provides swimming,squash and keep fit. Their busiest day is Sunday. At the moment they are building a gymnasium and extra squash courts.There will also be facilities for judo,karate and boxing. At the centre they employ 5 lifeguards,2 relief guards and 3 cashiers. The swimming pool is filtered every 4 hours to keep the water clean.Hydrochloric acid is added to increase the ph value and sodium hydrochloride to kill germs.Gas boilers heat the pool. The leisure centre is a very popular place of entertainment in Launceston.
